title: Eli Lilly 3Q Profit, Revenue Rise
text:
By Dave Sebastian

Eli Lilly & Co. (LLY) said its third-quarter profit rose as revenue climbed, driven by an 8% volume increase.

The pharmaceutical company posted net income of $1.25 billion, or $1.37 a share, compared with $1.15 billion, or $1.12 a share, in the comparable quarter last year.

On an adjusted basis, earnings were $1.48 a share, beating the $1.40 a share analysts polled by FactSet had expected. The company posted $1.34 a share in adjusted earnings in the year-earlier period.

Revenue for the quarter was $5.48 billion, slightly below the $5.5 billion analysts had expected. The company posted $5.31 billion in revenue a year ago.

Eli Lilly said revenue in the U.S. stayed flat at $3.06 billion as volume for its key products, such as Trulicity, Taltz and Emgality, offset volume drop in Cialis due to loss of patent exclusivity as well as the product withdrawal of Lartruvo. Overseas sales rose 8% to $2.42 billion, Eli Lilly said.

The company now expects per-share earnings to be between $8.59 and $8.69 for the full year, a penny higher from the previous range.

It sees adjusted earnings to be between $5.75 a share and $5.85 a share, up from its previous guidance of between $5.67 a share and $5.77 a share. Analysts polled by FactSet are expecting $5.72 a share for the full year.
